events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on highway 45 with two vehicles involved. Filed initial claim to start the process.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the incident description and involved vehicles.
An insurance agent, John Marks, has been assigned to the claim to assist the customer through the next steps.
Claim acknowledgement sent to the customer confirming receipt of the accident report and initiation of processing.
Request sent to customer asking for vehicle damage photos, police report, and driverâ€™s license copy to proceed with investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and detailed images of car damage post collision.
Investigation initiated by claims department to assess fault, damage extent, and validity of the claim reported.
Investigation completed confirming the collision circumstances and verifying the submitted evidence to support request.
Insurance company proposed a settlement based on damage assessment to cover vehicle repairs and customer inconvenience.
Customer provided positive feedback appreciating the timely settlement proposal and clear communication.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the settlement terms and satisfaction with the offer.
Settlement payment was issued to the customer to cover all approved vehicle repair costs from the accident claim.
The claim was officially closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by customer.
